summary: This document is an email chain from December 30, 2020, regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's conditions of confinement at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It includes a complaint from Maxwell's legal team about inaccurate information from MDC legal counsel, specific restrictions placed on Maxwell in her isolation cell, issues with food and discovery materials, and a response from an Assistant United States Attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; her legal team is complaining about her conditions of confinement at MDC, including restrictive directives in her isolation cell and issues with food and discovery materials.

persons.name: MEP
persons.context: The sender of the complaint email detailing issues with Maxwell's confinement, including inaccurate information from MDC legal, restrictive cell directives, food, and non-functional discovery discs. Appears to be a representative from the Law Offices of [redacted].

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The respondent who states they have reached out to MDC legal counsel to discuss the complaints about Maxwell's confinement and will follow up after that conversation.

connections.description: MEP is acting as legal counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, advocating on her behalf regarding her conditions of confinement.
The AUSA is the prosecuting attorney in Maxwell's case and is corresponding with her defense about issues related to her confinement.
Professional correspondence between the prosecuting attorney and the defense attorney regarding case-related logistical issues.

events.title: Guards Issue Restrictive Directives to Maxwell
events.description: Guards at MDC instructed Ghislaine Maxwell not to stand on either corner of her isolation cell, not to stand to the left or right of the toilet and sink, and not to stand within 2.5 feet of the cell door, under threat of disciplinary sanction.

events.title: Email Complaint Regarding Confinement Conditions
events.description: Maxwell's legal team (MEP) sends a detailed complaint to the AUSA about inaccurate information from MDC legal, restrictive cell directives, improper food, and non-functional discovery materials.

events.title: AUSA Contacts MDC Legal Counsel
events.description: The Assistant United States Attorney informs the defense that they have reached out to MDC legal counsel to discuss the complaints about Maxwell's conditions of confinement.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On December 29, 2020, guards at MDC gave Ghislaine Maxwell highly specific and restrictive directives about where she could stand in her isolation cell, contradicting prior assurances from MDC legal counsel.
Maxwell's legal team reported she was not receiving the food designated on her menu and that a discovery disc provided to her did not work on the MDC computer, requiring a replacement.
The defense requested the immediate production of a hard drive containing complete discovery to circumvent the disc issue.
An Assistant United States Attorney acknowledged the complaint and initiated contact with MDC legal counsel to address the issues raised.
The correspondence highlights ongoing disputes and logistical challenges regarding Maxwell's pretrial confinement and access to discovery materials in late 2020.
